title: 111_hr3498
content: The "Statewide PTV Access Act of 2009" may be cited as the short title. The Act addresses the secondary transmission of noncommercial stations by satellite carriers outside local markets. The "Statewide PTV Access Act of 2009" addresses secondary transmissions of noncommercial educational broadcast stations within a statewide network under the statutory license provided in title 17, United States Code. The "Statewide PTV Access Act of 2009" allows noncommercial educational broadcast stations in a statewide network to reach subscribers in counties outside their local market that are not served by a local noncommercial educational television station within the state. The "Statewide PTV Access Act of 2009" allows educational broadcast stations licensed to a single State or public agency to reach subscribers outside their local market. Section 119(b)(1)(B) of title 17, United States Code, is amended to include royalty fee provisions. Amendments to the Communications Act of 1934 include changes to royalty fee provisions for educational broadcast stations. Amendments to the Communications Act of 1934 now allow for the retransmission of a television broadcast station's signal outside its local market by a satellite carrier to its subscribers, under certain conditions. The Communications Act of 1934 now permits satellite carriers to retransmit noncommercial educational broadcast stations' signals to subscribers outside the station's local market, with specific conditions. The Communications Act of 1934 allows satellite carriers to transmit signals of noncommercial educational broadcast stations to subscribers outside the station's local market, with certain conditions. This includes networks of three or more stations licensed to a single entity in a state, where the signals can be carried to all subscribers in any county within that state not served by another noncommercial educational broadcast station.
